title: 112_hr3514
content: The Act titled "Everson Walls and Ron Springs Gift for Life Act of 2011" establishes a National Organ and Tissue Donor Registry Resource Center under the Public Health Service Act. The "Everson Walls and Ron Springs Gift for Life Act of 2011" establishes a National Organ and Tissue Donor Registry Resource Center (referred to as the 'Center') to advance the development, expansion, and evaluation of State organ and tissue donor registries. The Center facilitates timely access to accurate donor information between State registries, ensures compliance with operating standards, and provides technical assistance to States for the establishment and operation of registries. The "Everson Walls and Ron Springs Gift for Life Act of 2011" authorizes $5,000,000 for each fiscal year from 2012 to 2016 to establish and maintain a National Organ and Tissue Donor Registry Resource Center. This center will support State organ and tissue registries, maintain a registry information clearinghouse, and disseminate best practices information. SEC. 3. GRANTS FOR STATE ORGAN AND TISSUE DONOR REGISTRIES. This section authorizes grants for State organ and tissue donor registries. The Secretary will award grants to eligible entities to support State organ and tissue donor registries. Eligible entities are defined as State agencies or contracted entities. Funds must be used to develop, expand, or maintain registries and establish improvement benchmarks. Operating standards must be maintained for receiving grants for State registries. The tissue donor registry must allow donors to include statements about anatomical gifts, be accessible to organ procurement organizations 24/7, and ensure personally identifiable information is protected. The tissue donor registry requires express consent for using personally identifiable information, applications for grants must be submitted to the Secretary, and reports must be submitted every 180 days for grant recipients. An eligible entity must submit a report to the Secretary detailing the use of grant funds and assessing initiatives for replication in other states. $10,000,000 is authorized for fiscal years 2012 through 2016 for this purpose. SEC. 4. LIMITATION ON LIABILITY. Amends the Public Health Service Act to limit civil liability for harvesting organs without consent if the individual is registered as a donor. SEC. 5. STUDY ON FEASIBILITY OF ESTABLISHING A LIVING DONOR DATABASE. SEC. 5. STUDY ON FEASIBILITY OF ESTABLISHING A LIVING DONOR DATABASE. Amends the Public Health Service Act to study the feasibility of creating a living donor database to track health effects of organ donors.
